comment.author: 53227388@N00
comment._content: Looks like a grain grinder (not the exact same model, but a similar looking machine). So Dawson's may have been a flour mill.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/woesinger] Thank you! Dawson's may well have been a mill. From online searches, there seem to be a lot of Dawsons around Maynooth, and at one time there was a Castle Dawson...

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Manor Mills on the historic OSI map, where Mill Street crosses the Mill Race. It seems to be the only corn mill in Maynooth. maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,693552,737776,7,9

comment._content: Found a reference to a E H Bentall in Essex Agricultural Engineers Specialities: Chaff Cutters, Grinding Mills, Cattle Food preparing Machines, Petrol and Oil Engines and Engineers' Bright Steel Nuts, Bolts etc. Founded1790 Closed1984 194 years in business www.gracesguide.co.uk/E._H._Bentall_and_Co <

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: It was probably made by this guy, Edward Hammond Bentall, www.itsaboutmaldon.co.uk/bentall/. and en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Hammond_Bentall I suppose the Dublin address would be the local distributor.
